text:
Thanks for the response <@U03MJJ5Q4AG>! Atm, most of our users are from 10 timezones, but we want to send to all of them so probably all timezones.

> Other option would be to clone the email, create lists based on your time zone property, and schedule to send for each zone.
Few questions regarding your suggestion:
• Can this process be automated not just for the existing emails but also for future ones?
• Does it mean that we're duplicating a contact record?

• Can this process be automated not just for the existing emails but also for future ones?
Not in a way I can think of :disappointed: Once you make your lists, you won’t need to recreate those - it would be active lists based on contact property [Product Country] = country 1, [Product Country] = country 2, etc. But when you build your email it would be Email 1 - ET, then clone it x however many time zones.

• Does it mean that we’re duplicating a contact record?
Nope! You just need to add an additional property to the contact and map your Product Country to that field, and use that for your lists.

My thoughts are the same as Amber’s. Create an active list for each timezone, and then have 1 timezone list assigned to each email.

So if you have 10 timezones, you’re looking at 10 lists, and then 10 emails for the campaign, scheduled to send for each timezone accordingly.
